{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20895v1", "title": "Almgren's Three-Legged Starfish", "summary": "In this note we use classical tools from min-max and hyperbolic geometry to
substantiate a folklore example in Almgren--Pitts min-max theory, the
three-legged starfish metric on a 2-sphere, whose systolic length,
Almgren--Pitts width, and Gromov--Guth width are attained by ``figure-eight''
geodesics. We also recover a hyperbolic geometry fact about ``figure-eight''
geodesics using min-max.", "main_category": "math.DG", "categories": "math.DG", "published": "2025-04-29T16:13:40Z"}
